pros: I went to Toni Brockway to help me pursue my career in the nursing field and there was no hesitation what so ever. She got straight to work finding me schools and programs that collaborate with Hendrick Health. On the employment side of things; Sharayah Cope was very helpful in answering my questions and helping through the application process and getting me the documents I needed. I am very happy with both ladies and the over all help I got trying to start my life as a newly graduated adult.
cons: I have no cons with Hendrick health

pros: Good PTO accruel. Several locations to work. .
cons: Management needs work! I felt like I was in high school again working in radiology sonographer department. Hire management that’s qualified.

pros: Has a chick fil a
cons: Poor pay, expensive benefits that pay virtually nothing, entirely too many classes that must be attended outside of work hours on your days off.

review_title: Excited to embark on this new career path!

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Abilene, TX

cons: Nothing negative to report at the moment.

pros: Family oriented. Good place to work
cons: Small hospital, need more practitioners

pros: Good place to start here
cons: Floats all the time especially now

pros: The staff make the process of applying very smooth. They are very straight forward and respectful with their expectations. It is a very welcoming environment and Erica Hernandez with HR is very very helpful!
cons: I haven't officially started, but as far as I can tell there are no cons.

pros: Having a job as a Nurse.
cons:
You have to do a lot of Surveys but nothing gets fixed or changes. 
Management is part of the problem, so are the Nurses. 
They put you with a preceptor that hates their job and they're really negative and it makes you want to quit shortly afterwards.
Forget reporting anything to management, especially if you're new. 
Best thing to do is go to work and keep your mouth shut.
There's a lot of diversity but no inclusion.

pros: Good colleagues, work space, timings, flexibility

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Abilene, TX

cons: Insurance is awful. Parking at north is bad. Management is clickish and HR states there’s nothing they can do to help when you have gone through chain of command that’s not already compromised

pros: I have not officially started my employment so I don’t have any pros but the hiring process was very fast and the HR rep was very helpful.
cons: I have not officially started my employment so I don’t have any cons.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Abilene, TX

pros: Work schedule is Monday thru Friday

pros: A learning hospital that provides a good learning environment. Good management in most units that care about their employees. Family oriented.
cons: New graduate nurses whether ADN or BSN receive the same salary. No other hospitals around to compete with so no market adjustments. Benefits are not much to boast about. Holiday pay is only a differential pay not time and a half like most other places.

pros: Small community ample networking within HHS. Great Nurse to patient ratio
cons: Management stagnant. Low pay compared to metroplex

pros: Coworkers are typically supportive. Education department is kind and supportive. IT department works hard to help you.
cons: Management is disrespectful to employees. When switching between departments there is no support. If you make one manager upset by asking to move positions, you are talked about and ridiculed to other mangers with no hope of ever having a fair shot of moving to another department.

pros: If you are good at writing and have a great resume/CV, you are an easy in.

pros:
Company will assist you in every step of the way.
HR can be easily contacted and very accommodating.
cons: It is not in a big city but it depends on what you are looking for a place of work.

pros: Friendly working environment, no bullying ( lateral) noted so far. encourages learning and growth
cons: have so many things that are shady  in regard to pay and contracts.  for example and was given a different contract to sign while I was still in my home  when  I was offer the job. when I got here  after having moved my entire family and kids registered in school , when I got to the HR , I was given a total new contract to sign with clauses that were not in the original  contract.  I felt like I was stocked with it  and when I asked why the difference, I was informed the original contract was given to me by the recruiter and not from them. but when I argue that it was sent to me through the recruiter but it was on Hendrick's  letter head ,  they still refused to honor the original contract. so I felt like I was  tricked  and that is very shady.  Again they have good benefit like the student loan reimbursement , but they will intentionally not tell new hire  and you have to apply within a certain time , (6 month) of hire date and if you do no t know, then you miss it and they can not offer any more.    health insurance sucks; even with insurance medical  co pay are so high and ridiculous

pros: Their core values as a company and a hospital gives you all of the reason to want to work here. They are in the business for the right reasons, and it shows throughout their team.
cons: Cannot find any at this moment in time.

review_title: Good place to start you nursing career
pros: Great educators. Very professional and approachable.
cons: Location. Lack of experienced staff.

pros: Most units are self schedule
cons: Management is not very personable

pros: Great orientation with a ton of education
cons: Low pay, rapid turnover, poor unit management

pros: There are a lot of really great people that work at Hendrick
cons: Some times it seems as though they don’t have your back

review_title: Great Environment and Quality of Work
pros:
Leadership is unlike any job I have been at. Not only do I feel mentored by the leaders at Hendrick, but they are people I actually enjoy being around. Most companies I have worked for the bosses are not people I want to spend time with but in my department this is not the case. 
Along with this, it creates an environment of trust and communication which in turn leads to more dedicated employees. Most of the workers at Hendrick have been here for years on end and many people tell me that they could never leave due to the work environment and center on Christ like missions.
cons: Due to the great work environment, it makes it very difficult to be apart of the Hendrick system. I applied to over 5 positions and never received an offer or an interview. I know many people that are trying to work at Hendrick but they don't know where to start to get in. Also the pay is not the best but what you make up for in less pay is an environment where coming to work is something to look forward to. I believe it to be a worthy trade but I do know that at most places like Lowe's or Walmart you can make close to the same pay.

job_title: ER Admissions Clerk in Abilene, TX
pros: Friendly, helpful, communicative, clean, good nature
cons: parking, food, location, unflavorable, employees

pros: Hendrick is a hospital that serves surrounding the counties.  Many patients who come to the Trauma Center do not see a Primary Care Physician.  The Trauma Center "is" their Primary Physician.  Some parts of the hospital are new and fresh and look nice.
cons:
Some older parts of the facility look worn, sad, run down, and depressing.  Also, many visitors look lost and ask for directions.  Improved signage could help them get to their destinations more easily.
The cafeteria seating area is dirty and crowded.  Many visitors and employees come to the cafeteria to enjoy a few minutes before getting back to work or caring for loved ones.

job_title: Medical Laboratory Technician in Abilene, TX
pros: Works with you through personal medical issues.
cons: Majority of coworkers not friendly

pros: Hendrick provides me with a great work life balance. The benefits associated are incredible and they offer reduced cost on health insurance based on a wellness screening. I believe that Hendrick cares for my well-being. From employee to employee interaction to the interactions with leadership, I know that I belong here and I am treated with respect every single day. Hendrick has given me opportunities to grow professionally. I love that Hendrick offers a wide variety of opportunities from being involved with Employee Wellness activities to all the ways I can support out local communality through outreaches and fundraisers. Even though I don't have direct patient care, I know that my job and responsibilities influences those who have direct patient care.  I know that our Executive Leadership is one that cares about employees and patients and does their very best to make decisions for what is right for Hendrick and Abilene.
cons: Not a whole lot. I would say that Hendrick values their employees opinions and when there is an area for improvement, our Leadership does everything in their ability to make changes and to listen to the employees.

pros: No Pros, They do not have people in charge that are qualified for the job.
cons: No communication with employees. To many Chief’s.

pros: After spending more than 30 yearsin the healthcare industry, many of those years being spent in other cities, I can honestly say this the best healthcare institution with which I have ever been employed. Of course there are tough times, but that is healthcare. What impresses me the MOST about Hendrick is the endeavor of employees to LIVE out the Mission Statement every day with every encounter. From the CEO, all the way down the ladder, the patient is at the center of every decision. Employees are empowered to participate in changes and voice opinions regarding new decisions. Obviously, no every employee or every patient will be pleased, but the effort is made every time. Prior to my employment with Hendrick, I was looking to leave the Abilene area; now I plan on retiring from Hendrick. I am proud to be part of this team and to make a positive impact on the Abilene and surrounding communities.
cons: Lower than industry standard pay

pros: Easy to get in. Hours are decent.
cons:
Unless you know someone you will never advance in this hospital. It's about who you know and not what you know. Politics play a huge part in this job. Interviewing for advancement doesn't mean a thing unless you know someone. If they "like" you, you're in. If not, you're screwed. 

The pay is also the worse when it comes to the medical field. They spend so much money on the hospital but yet, cut back overtime opportunities, pay, raises and bonuses. Short staffed, constant call-ins and hiring the wrong kind of people make this a difficult environment to work in.

pros:
Nurses in ICU are awesome for the most part
ICU has a nice layout
The other units are great to work for
There are MANY physicians who really care about their patients and the staff taking care of them. The physicians take the time to get to know other staff; of course, like any hospital, there are a few bad doctors.
cons:
A few nurses in ICU are stuck up/think they're God's gift to nursing
Management doesn't care about patient safety or nurse safety
You're lucky if you have a tech in ICU that will do their job.

review_title: Great leadership from the top down
pros: Hendrick truly is a great place to work. Every encounter that I have had, from the CEO to the new employees, has been incredible. The leadership at Hendrick makes their decisions with the entire healthcare system in mind. Patient safety is #1 and every employee has been empowered from their leaders to do their very best everyday. Hendrick has a great benefits package and everything that I need for my family is met through this job. Hendrick has many free perks and events for their employees - couldn't ask for more from an employer!
cons: Like all companies, Hendrick falls short in some areas. But overall, i don't think there is any cons to working at Hendrick.

review_title: Great place to work for a little while.
pros: Great benefits, great HR department, great learning environment. Definitely a place for people wanting to see if they like the medical field and for people who are already professionals to get experience and eventually move on.
cons: Pay is not that great. Some departments will give more responsibility then you're qualified for. Management in certain departments can be hard to deal with, hard for them to see your point of view and can be hypocritical in decision making.

job_title: RN Clinical Manager in Abilene, TX
pros: Hendrick puts their employees FIRST and makes sure they are the primary considerations when changes take place.  We are part of the Hendrick Family and we support each other and work together as a team.  I started working here 32 years ago and have worked in several different capacities.  Would not want to work anywhere else, because nowhere else can measure up to the HMC Standard!
cons: There really aren't any down-sides.  I guess like any big company, it takes awhile to get things done when changes need to be made, but that seems to be better than it used to be.

pros:
*Patient-centered care
*Christian organization
*Some autonomy
*Feel like I am a contributor to providing better care
*Making a positive contribution to the community
*Feels like family
cons:
*Pay too low for workload, even with experience
*Job expectations increase even though pay does not.  Not even a bonus structure.
*Difficult to discipline as a manager without HR's okay.  Just Culture is good, but not when it is applied intermittently.
*Getting new FTEs approved is difficult, even when easily justified
*New CEO is brining too much of the "for-profit" feel with him
*CFO has unrealistic expectations and will not listen to experience

pros:
In today's economy... It's a job. Lots of good people to work with. 
You just can't trust any of them....
cons:
It's a big high school. Constant gossip traveling the halls. Even the cafeteria is a reminder of school. Various clicks sitting at the same tables everyday.   And if you do not live a lifestyle they see fit then
You have a target on your back.  Management ask employees for ideas on how to improve and even form committees, but in the end they do what is financially beneficial instead of improving quality of care.  If you need a job in healthcare, look else where.

pros: Easy with most weekends off. Pay is okay for area in which i live. A lot of nice people working there and easy to get along with most people.
cons: Kind of a dead end. They offer opportunities to move up but there really are none. People have worked there 30 years doing the same thing with little to no advancement. The company really does everything to take care of itself first.

review_title: If you're a hard worker,  pass this place on by..
job_title: Medical Records Technician in Abilene, TX
pros:
Job security 
Charge meals to check
Health screenings
cons: Lazy employees are not disciplined in any way and allowed to not do their job, even sleep on the clock which increases load on other employees. It takes alot to actually be let go from this place. Charge meals to check. Low pay. No bonus or incentive for a job done well. Claims Christian values but all for show.

review_title: Local hospital, largest employer in area
pros: Easy to move up in the company if you are willing to stay there for a while. The HR team works really hard for employee engagement and there are several opportunities year round to get involved. The new additions of the hospital have also been great!
cons: Pay could be more, but it is decent for the area. Friendly environment facilitated through the Gallup survey's that employees are required to take. Parking can be some what annoying.

review_title: A Lot of changes for better and for worse.
job_title: A Long Term Hard Worker in Abilene, TX
pros: For patient care this hospital is top notch. Great medical staff and up to date technology. Always building bigger and better things for the future of healthcare.
cons: Too much employee turnover. Not enough incentives for employees who work hard (EX:Noticed same employees chosen for Employee of the Quarter 2 or 3 different times when others with 15,20 or 25+ years and HR folders to prove their worthiness are never chosen for it). Lots of favoritism in management. Some employees seem to get away with murder when others who go above and beyond their duties are just expected to deal with it. The feelings of co-workers dealing with other under performing employees are not dealt with accordingly, basically if you can do all the work, the other "warm body" sits beside you doing nothing is OK since at the end of the day all the work is done and you both come back and do it again the next day. Is this the meaning of a "Gallop Great Workplace"?  There needs to better training of new hires and all employees should share equal work duties in their respective areas. Too many new hires seem to not know what they walked into and basically "freeze in place". Better HR screening would alleviate this.

pros: Hendrick has the best people, from peers to leadership! I've never worked with a unit at HMC that didn't have the team feel. As an RN, I am shown appreciation by leadership & I can tell that they invest into their nurses. My voice is heard and there are always plenty of educational opportunities for me to advance my career.
cons: I live an hour away, so the commute is hard. However, I choose to make that commute to work somewhere where my opinion counts

review_title: Hendrick Medical Center is the best!
pros: Hendrick cares about their employees. Health screenings are provided to help you keep track annually of how you are doing. Hendrick celebrates its employees! It is a large company but it doesn't feel like it when you walk around and see people you know all of the time over years because we have worked here for so long.
cons: The cafeteria food could be better.

pros: Competitive compensation, especially if you put in some overtime. Opportunity to advance and specialize as a clinical pharmacist through decentralized staffing, cross training, and paid professional development. Pharmacy leadership encourages growth and talent.  Management is very accommodating in terms of holiday/time off/ scheduling. Retention bonus tied  to 3 year contract available for clinical staff. The hospital as an entity is continuing to growth in the area.
cons: Lackluster 403b retirement match (3%), fees, and fund administrator (Guidestone), long vesting period (5 years). Never had to use health insurance so can't comment.

pros: Hendrick is the best organization I have ever worked for because of its mission!  I sat in church thinking about foreign mission work, and going somewhere else to serve.  Then I realized I am fortunate to do Christ's work every day at Hendrick.  It is my mission field.  It may not be in a far off location, but it has the same impact.
cons: I have a lot of responsibility within my team.

review_title: Winner of Gallup Great Workplace Award For Last 5 Years  - AND  it is well deserved!
job_title: Manager, Physician Practice Management in Abilene, TX
pros: Great leadership, opportunity to advance and  caring co-workers!
cons: Community hospital - low wages.  Some Directors lack direction. Lazy employees are rarely fired.

job_title: Manager Outpatient Rehab Services in Abilene, TX
pros: Hendrick Center for Rehab is a great place to work.   We provide high quality therapy  in a Christian environment.    My staff truly care about their patients.  They strive to return the patient to the previous level of function. or best quality of life possible.
cons: We need more space to take care of our patients.   We are growing and expanding so additional  renovated space to provide high quality care would be wonderful.

pros: It was a good opportunity to gain skills, great patient interaction, and some floors/ departments had great teamwork. Lots of exposure to new situations.
cons: Low pay when compared to similar jobs. Some managers refused to weed out those with a poor work ethic, choosing to keep a 'warm body' instead.

review_title: Great place to work for. Salary cap makes it difficult to want to stay.
pros: Great place to work. Friendly people and they show you they appreciate you. Very family and community oriented. Free ham or turkey for Christmas or Thanksgiving.
cons: Mandatory overtime and salary cap. The hospital is usually understaffed. The health benefits are over priced and under performance and usually end up taking half of your check.

pros: I was recently hired on and so far the people are so warm and welcoming. I attended other interviews for positions elsewhere and knew right away that this was the place I wanted to work.
cons: The salary is not as competitive as other places I applied.

job_title: Professional Development Specialist in Abilene, TX
pros: I love the atmosphere at Hendrick! Staff members are like one big, happy family! Management shows that they care and they do listen to you. There are many opportunities for advancement. There are many different areas of nursing to work in.  Abilene is a pretty nice place to raise a family.
cons: Staff turnover/retention can some lead to larger patient loads.  Education can sometimes be a hard with all of the healthcare changes.

pros: The Hendrick environment is positive and supportive.
cons: This particular position has bad scheduling. Every day is different based on where you will be that day on a drive. We often times work all day with little to no break for lunch. The pay is not enough for us to do all the work we do.

job_title: Diagnostic Medical Sonographer in Abilene, TX
pros: Provide excellent equipment.  Friendly work environment.
cons: Since there is little competition, the wages are low compared with other hospitals.  They fail to offer some benefits that other hospitals offer such as PRN pay, travel time on call, competitive call rates per hour.

pros: Hendrick has given me the opportunity to learn and grow so that I can help those within our organization.  We have wonderful leadership that supports the Mission and Values of the organization.
cons: None to mention at the time.

pros: Working has a team and making the work place stronger
cons: People deserve a second chance at a same department I know some do and so do I don't see that fair at all

pros: Wonderful leadership, great benefits, faith-based practice, high expectations for employees, company is growing, long tradition in the Abilene community, high employee engagement
cons: None of significance to share.  While not every department is perfect, overall, employees get along well with each other and managers address problems.

review_title:
RN
Started day shift on Med/surf, ended on night shift in ICU
job_title: RN Night Shift in Abilene, TX
pros:
Great coworkers
Up-to-date equipment
Great nurse:patient ratios
Good cafeteria food
Ability to advance career
Frequent raises in salary
Adequate training
Phlebotomists for lab draws (apparently that's not a thing a my new employer)
cons:
Seemed to be a shortage in some equipment at times
I can't think of any other cons at this time.

pros: There is a great community here. Employees from all departments are kind, and greet you with a smile. We have a wonderful mission statement and I find that it rings to true to what we actually do on a day to day basis.
cons: Some management is out dated, and we could use more employees.

pros: Great place to use one's gifts. Fair compensation and benefits. Family oriented workplace. Spirituality permeates organization in a good way.
cons: Few opportunities for advancement. They always seem to look outside for leadership positions instead of promoting from within.

pros: Facility is growing and has a new hospice unit in the works for 2016. Patient ratios were reasonable and nurse managers were helpful. Has tuition reimbursement available. Workout facility is very nice.
cons: Company insurance is a joke and constantly changing. Just dropped BBBS patients so should be interesting.

review_title: Company with lots of heart, but not dollars
pros: Their people.  In both clinical and non clinical roles.  The people are kind, genuine, and helpful
cons: You just don't get paid for your work.  And their policy on holiday pay is COMPLETE Bull.

pros: I enjoy working in an environment where my opinion counts and I am provided to tools to do my job well.  I also love that I can freely express my faith with those around me.
cons: I do not have any at this time.

review_title: Great place to work- some management issues
pros: Infrastructure well in place. Great schedule and hours.
cons: Management for my dept. Is plagued by favoritism  and poor leadership skills.

pros: Excellent healthcare facility, friendly environment, effectively prepared for a crisis
cons: Occasional disappointments in the work ethics of coworkers

pros: Good benifits,  nice Salary,Flexible schedule
cons: As a correctional nurse you are left out of the loop with any activities at the hospital. We do not get to enjoy the dress code of the hospital. We are not allowed to bring spreads to work like the hospital employees.

review_title: An organization with one of the worlds most engaged workforces focused on excellent patient care.
job_title: Manager of Patient Relations and Risk Management in Abilene, TX
pros: Excellent patient care is a central focus of everything we do, which means everyone’s role in the organization is built around that focus. There are endless growth and professional development opportunities.
cons: Compensation sometimes lags advancement in responsibilities.

job_title: Pharmacy Operations Manager in Abilene, TX
pros: Hendrick is truly a family. I have a lot of opportunity to learn and grow, and I have a lot of support along the way.
cons: Managing and staffing a 24/7 department is challenging but I am a much more well-rounded leader, employee, and person because of my experiences.

job_title: Profesiona Developmn Specialist in Abilene, TX
pros: Hendrick  strives to live up to their Mission and Vision. Hendrick values it's employees. Hendrick gives great care.
